Patient Particulars: Dorothy; 70yrs; Female; living at a convalescent home for past 6 months; known case of congestive heart failure
Referral Information: Admitted to Emergency 5 days back; Referred by: a nurse to the therapist; Reason for referral: Preoccupation with worries about getting intubated in future
Presenting Complaints (Symptoms): 1. Apprehension about getting intubated in future: NA
History: The patient is a known case of Congestive Heart Failure and was apparently maintaining well till 5 days back when she started having difficulty in breathing. She was rushed to the emergency where the doctors intubated her in order to save her life. The patient was made aware of the procedure following which she gestured to convey that she does not consent. Despite that she was intubated. She reports that it was a horrifying experience for her. Following discharge she has had constant thoughts that if a similar situation arises again, she would have to go through the same traumatic experience again. When she shared this with an acquaintance who happens to be a nurse in the same hospital, she referred the patient to the therapist.
Current Mental Status Examination: Affect: Euthymic; Speech: Rate, Tone, Volume and Productivity are Normal, Thought content: Preoccupation about getting intubated, Judgement: Intact
Issues discussed in Current Session: Patien's right to refuse invasive treatment to save her life
Reflections by the therapist: It was difficult to build a rapport with the patient. she kept on seeking reassurance that her decisions would be respected and taken care of. In the end the patient trusted the therapist and got convinced
